children.text: There has been an obvious repair to the top of the finished floor slab.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances, clause 2.12 Repairs to Exposed Concrete Slabs states that
‘The repair is defective if it does not, as closely as practical, match the existing work in appearance, colour and texture’.
The finish of this exposed concrete floor will need to be rectified so that it is consistent in appearance, which will most likely require it to be re-topped (a thin concrete screed applied).
